trans-unit.source: Azure Mobile Engagement Android SDK Integration
trans-unit.target: Azure Mobile Engagement Android SDK Integration

trans-unit.source: Latest updates and procedures for Android SDK for Azure Mobile Engagement
trans-unit.target: Latest updates and procedures for Android SDK for Azure Mobile Engagement

trans-unit.source: How to Integrate Engagement on Android
trans-unit.target: How to Integrate Engagement on Android

trans-unit.source: This procedure describes the simplest way to activate Engagement's Analytics and Monitoring functions in your Android application.
trans-unit.target: This procedure describes the simplest way to activate Engagement's Analytics and Monitoring functions in your Android application.

trans-unit.source: Your minimum Android SDK API level must be 10 or higher (Android 2.3.3 or higher).
trans-unit.target: Your minimum Android SDK API level must be 10 or higher (Android 2.3.3 or higher).

trans-unit.source: The following steps are enough to activates the report of logs needed to compute all statistics regarding Users, Sessions, Activities, Crashes and Technicals.
trans-unit.target: The following steps are enough to activates the report of logs needed to compute all statistics regarding Users, Sessions, Activities, Crashes and Technicals.

trans-unit.source: The report of logs needed to compute other statistics like Events, Errors and Jobs must be done manually using the Engagement API (see <link><linkText>How to use the advanced Mobile Engagement tagging API in your Android</linkText><title></title></link> since these statistics are application dependent.
trans-unit.target: The report of logs needed to compute other statistics like Events, Errors and Jobs must be done manually using the Engagement API (see <link><linkText>How to use the advanced Mobile Engagement tagging API in your Android</linkText><title></title></link> since these statistics are application dependent.

trans-unit.source: Embed the Engagement SDK and service into your Android project
trans-unit.target: Embed the Engagement SDK and service into your Android project

trans-unit.source: Download the Android SDK from <link><linkText>here</linkText><title></title></link>
trans-unit.target: Download the Android SDK from <link><linkText>here</linkText><title></title></link>

trans-unit.source: Get mobile-engagement-VERSION.jar and put them into the libs folder of your Android project (create the libs folder if it does not exist yet).
trans-unit.target: Get mobile-engagement-VERSION.jar and put them into the libs folder of your Android project (create the libs folder if it does not exist yet).

trans-unit.source: If you build your application package with ProGuard, you need to keep some classes.
trans-unit.target: If you build your application package with ProGuard, you need to keep some classes.

trans-unit.source: You can use the following configuration snippet:
trans-unit.target: You can use the following configuration snippet:

trans-unit.source: -keep public class * extends android.os.IInterface
trans-unit.target: -keep public class * extends android.os.IInterface

trans-unit.source: -keep class com.microsoft.azure.engagement.reach.activity.EngagementWebAnnouncementActivity$EngagementReachContentJS {
trans-unit.target: -keep class com.microsoft.azure.engagement.reach.activity.EngagementWebAnnouncementActivity$EngagementReachContentJS {

trans-unit.source: <html></html>;
trans-unit.target: <html></html>;

trans-unit.source: Specify your Engagement connection string by calling the following method in the launcher activity:
trans-unit.target: Specify your Engagement connection string by calling the following method in the launcher activity:

trans-unit.source: The connection string for your application is displayed on Azure Portal.
trans-unit.target: The connection string for your application is displayed on Azure Portal.

trans-unit.source: If missing, add the following Android permissions (before the tag):
trans-unit.target: If missing, add the following Android permissions (before the tag):

trans-unit.source: Add the following section (between the and tags):
trans-unit.target: Add the following section (between the and tags):

trans-unit.source: Change by the name of your application.
trans-unit.target: Change by the name of your application.

trans-unit.source: The android:label attribute allows you to choose the name of the Engagement service as it will appear to the end-users in the "Running services" screen of their phone. It is recommended to set this attribute to "Service" (e.g. "AcmeFunGameService").
trans-unit.target: The android:label attribute allows you to choose the name of the Engagement service as it will appear to the end-users in the "Running services" screen of their phone. It is recommended to set this attribute to "Service" (e.g. "AcmeFunGameService").

trans-unit.source: Specifying the android:process attribute ensures that the Engagement service will run in its own process (running Engagement in the same process as your application will make your main/UI thread potentially less responsive).
trans-unit.target: Specifying the android:process attribute ensures that the Engagement service will run in its own process (running Engagement in the same process as your application will make your main/UI thread potentially less responsive).

trans-unit.source: Any code you place in Application.onCreate() and other application callbacks will be run for all your application's processes, including the Engagement service.
trans-unit.target: Any code you place in Application.onCreate() and other application callbacks will be run for all your application's processes, including the Engagement service.

trans-unit.source: It may have unwanted side effects (like unneeded memory allocations and threads in the Engagement's process, duplicate broadcast receivers or services).
trans-unit.target: It may have unwanted side effects (like unneeded memory allocations and threads in the Engagement's process, duplicate broadcast receivers or services).

trans-unit.source: If you override Application.onCreate(), it's recommended to add the following code snippet at the beginning of your Application.onCreate() function:
trans-unit.target: If you override Application.onCreate(), it's recommended to add the following code snippet at the beginning of your Application.onCreate() function:

trans-unit.source: You can do the same thing for Application.onTerminate(), Application.onLowMemory() and Application.onConfigurationChanged(...).
trans-unit.target: You can do the same thing for Application.onTerminate(), Application.onLowMemory() and Application.onConfigurationChanged(...).

trans-unit.source: You can also extend EngagementApplication instead of extending Application: the callback Application.onCreate() does the process check and calls Application.onApplicationProcessCreate() only if the current process is not the one hosting the Engagement service, the same rules apply for the other callbacks.
trans-unit.target: You can also extend EngagementApplication instead of extending Application: the callback Application.onCreate() does the process check and calls Application.onApplicationProcessCreate() only if the current process is not the one hosting the Engagement service, the same rules apply for the other callbacks.

trans-unit.source: Basic reporting
trans-unit.target: Basic reporting

trans-unit.source: Recommended method: overload your Activity classes
trans-unit.target: Recommended method: overload your Activity classes

trans-unit.source: In order to activate the report of all the logs required by Engagement to compute Users, Sessions, Activities, Crashes and Technical statistics, you just have to make all your *Activity sub-classes inherit from the corresponding Engagement*Activity classes (e.g. if your legacy activity extends ListActivity, make it extends EngagementListActivity).
trans-unit.target: In order to activate the report of all the logs required by Engagement to compute Users, Sessions, Activities, Crashes and Technical statistics, you just have to make all your *Activity sub-classes inherit from the corresponding Engagement*Activity classes (e.g. if your legacy activity extends ListActivity, make it extends EngagementListActivity).

trans-unit.source: Without Engagement :
trans-unit.target: Without Engagement :

trans-unit.source: With Engagement :
trans-unit.target: With Engagement :

trans-unit.source: When using EngagementListActivity or EngagementExpandableListActivity, make sure any call to requestWindowFeature(...); is made before the call to super.onCreate(...);, otherwise a crash will occur.
trans-unit.target: When using EngagementListActivity or EngagementExpandableListActivity, make sure any call to requestWindowFeature(...); is made before the call to super.onCreate(...);, otherwise a crash will occur.

trans-unit.source: We provide sub-classes of FragmentActivity and MapActivity, but to avoid problems with applications using ProGuard, we do not include them in engagement.jar.
trans-unit.target: We provide sub-classes of FragmentActivity and MapActivity, but to avoid problems with applications using ProGuard, we do not include them in engagement.jar.

trans-unit.source: You can find these classes in the src folder, and can copy them into your project.
trans-unit.target: You can find these classes in the src folder, and can copy them into your project.

trans-unit.source: The classes are also in the JavaDoc.
trans-unit.target: The classes are also in the JavaDoc.

trans-unit.source: Alternate method: call startActivity() and endActivity() manually
trans-unit.target: Alternate method: call startActivity() and endActivity() manually

trans-unit.source: If you cannot or do not want to overload your Activity classes, you can instead start and end your activities by calling EngagementAgent's methods directly.
trans-unit.target: If you cannot or do not want to overload your Activity classes, you can instead start and end your activities by calling EngagementAgent's methods directly.

trans-unit.source: The Android SDK never calls the endActivity() method, even when the application is closed (on Android, applications are actually never closed).
trans-unit.target: The Android SDK never calls the endActivity() method, even when the application is closed (on Android, applications are actually never closed).

trans-unit.source: Thus, it is HIGHLY recommended to call the startActivity() method in the onResume callback of ALL your activities, and the endActivity() method in the onPause() callback of ALL your activities.
trans-unit.target: Thus, it is HIGHLY recommended to call the startActivity() method in the onResume callback of ALL your activities, and the endActivity() method in the onPause() callback of ALL your activities.

trans-unit.source: This is the only way to be sure that sessions will not be leaked.
trans-unit.target: This is the only way to be sure that sessions will not be leaked.

trans-unit.source: If a session is leaked, the Engagement service will never disconnect from the Engagement backend (since the service stays connected as long as a session is pending).
trans-unit.target: If a session is leaked, the Engagement service will never disconnect from the Engagement backend (since the service stays connected as long as a session is pending).

trans-unit.source: Here is an example:
trans-unit.target: Here is an example:

trans-unit.source: This example very similiar to the EngagementActivity class and its variants, whose source code is provided in the src folder.
trans-unit.target: This example very similiar to the EngagementActivity class and its variants, whose source code is provided in the src folder.

trans-unit.source: Test
trans-unit.target: Test

trans-unit.source: Now please verify your integration by running your mobile app in an emulator or device and verifying that it registers a session on the Monitor tab.
trans-unit.target: Now please verify your integration by running your mobile app in an emulator or device and verifying that it registers a session on the Monitor tab.

trans-unit.source: The next sections are optional.
trans-unit.target: The next sections are optional.

trans-unit.source: Location reporting
trans-unit.target: Location reporting

trans-unit.source: If you want locations to be reported, you need to add a few lines of configuration (between the and tags).
trans-unit.target: If you want locations to be reported, you need to add a few lines of configuration (between the and tags).

trans-unit.source: Lazy area location reporting
trans-unit.target: Lazy area location reporting

trans-unit.source: Lazy area location reporting allows to report the country, region and locality associated to devices.
trans-unit.target: Lazy area location reporting allows to report the country, region and locality associated to devices.

trans-unit.source: This type of location reporting only uses network locations (based on Cell ID or WIFI).
trans-unit.target: This type of location reporting only uses network locations (based on Cell ID or WIFI).

trans-unit.source: The device area is reported at most once per session.
trans-unit.target: The device area is reported at most once per session.

trans-unit.source: The GPS is never used, and thus this type of location report has very few (not to say no) impact on the battery.
trans-unit.target: The GPS is never used, and thus this type of location report has very few (not to say no) impact on the battery.

trans-unit.source: Reported areas are used to compute geographic statistics about users, sessions, events and errors.
trans-unit.target: Reported areas are used to compute geographic statistics about users, sessions, events and errors.

trans-unit.source: They can also be used as criterion in Reach campaigns.
trans-unit.target: They can also be used as criterion in Reach campaigns.

trans-unit.source: To enable lazy area location reporting, you can do it by using the configuration previously mentioned in this procedure :
trans-unit.target: To enable lazy area location reporting, you can do it by using the configuration previously mentioned in this procedure :

trans-unit.source: You also need to add the following permission if missing:
trans-unit.target: You also need to add the following permission if missing:

trans-unit.source: Or you can keep using ACCESS_FINE_LOCATION if you already use it in your application.
trans-unit.target: Or you can keep using ACCESS_FINE_LOCATION if you already use it in your application.

trans-unit.source: Real time location reporting
trans-unit.target: Real time location reporting

trans-unit.source: Real time location reporting allows to report the latitude and longitude associated to devices.
trans-unit.target: Real time location reporting allows to report the latitude and longitude associated to devices.

trans-unit.source: By default, this type of location reporting only uses network locations (based on Cell ID or WIFI), and the reporting is only active when the application runs in foreground (i.e. during a session).
trans-unit.target: By default, this type of location reporting only uses network locations (based on Cell ID or WIFI), and the reporting is only active when the application runs in foreground (i.e. during a session).

trans-unit.source: Real time locations are NOT used to compute statistics.
trans-unit.target: Real time locations are NOT used to compute statistics.

trans-unit.source: Their only purpose is to allow the use of real time
trans-unit.target: Their only purpose is to allow the use of real time

trans-unit.source: geo-fencing \<html></html> criterion in Reach campaigns.
trans-unit.target: geo-fencing \<html></html> criterion in Reach campaigns.

trans-unit.source: To enable real time location reporting, you can do it by using the configuration previously mentioned in this procedure :
trans-unit.target: To enable real time location reporting, you can do it by using the configuration previously mentioned in this procedure :

trans-unit.source: You also need to add the following permission if missing:
trans-unit.target: You also need to add the following permission if missing:

trans-unit.source: Or you can keep using ACCESS_FINE_LOCATION if you already use it in your application.
trans-unit.target: Or you can keep using ACCESS_FINE_LOCATION if you already use it in your application.

trans-unit.source: GPS based reporting
trans-unit.target: GPS based reporting

trans-unit.source: By default, real time location reporting only uses network based locations.
trans-unit.target: By default, real time location reporting only uses network based locations.

trans-unit.source: To enable the use of GPS based locations (which are far more precise), use the configuration object:
trans-unit.target: To enable the use of GPS based locations (which are far more precise), use the configuration object:

trans-unit.source: You also need to add the following permission if missing:
trans-unit.target: You also need to add the following permission if missing:

trans-unit.source: Background reporting
trans-unit.target: Background reporting

trans-unit.source: By default, real time location reporting is only active when the application runs in foreground (i.e. during a session).
trans-unit.target: By default, real time location reporting is only active when the application runs in foreground (i.e. during a session).

trans-unit.source: To enable the reporting also in background, use the configuration object:
trans-unit.target: To enable the reporting also in background, use the configuration object:

trans-unit.source: When the application runs in background, only network based locations are reported, even if you enabled the GPS.
trans-unit.target: When the application runs in background, only network based locations are reported, even if you enabled the GPS.

trans-unit.source: The background location report will be stopped if the user reboots its device, you can add this to make it automatically restart at boot time:
trans-unit.target: The background location report will be stopped if the user reboots its device, you can add this to make it automatically restart at boot time:

trans-unit.source: You also need to add the following permission if missing:
trans-unit.target: You also need to add the following permission if missing:

trans-unit.source: Android M permissions
trans-unit.target: Android M permissions

trans-unit.source: Starting with Android M, some permissions are managed at runtime and needs user approval.
trans-unit.target: Starting with Android M, some permissions are managed at runtime and needs user approval.

trans-unit.source: The runtime permissions will be turned off by default for new app installations if you target Android API level 23.
trans-unit.target: The runtime permissions will be turned off by default for new app installations if you target Android API level 23.

trans-unit.source: Otherwise it will be turned on by default.
trans-unit.target: Otherwise it will be turned on by default.

trans-unit.source: The user can enable/disable those permissions from the device settings menu.
trans-unit.target: The user can enable/disable those permissions from the device settings menu.

trans-unit.source: Turning off permissions from system menu kills background processes of the application, this is a system behavior and has no impact on ability to receive push in background.
trans-unit.target: Turning off permissions from system menu kills background processes of the application, this is a system behavior and has no impact on ability to receive push in background.

trans-unit.source: In the context of Mobile Engagement, the permissions that require approval at runtime are:
trans-unit.target: In the context of Mobile Engagement, the permissions that require approval at runtime are:

trans-unit.source: ACCESS_COARSE_LOCATION
trans-unit.target: ACCESS_COARSE_LOCATION

trans-unit.source: ACCESS_FINE_LOCATION
trans-unit.target: ACCESS_FINE_LOCATION

trans-unit.source: WRITE_EXTERNAL_STORAGE (only when targeting Android API level 23 for this one)
trans-unit.target: WRITE_EXTERNAL_STORAGE (only when targeting Android API level 23 for this one)

trans-unit.source: The external storage is used only for Reach big picture feature.
trans-unit.target: The external storage is used only for Reach big picture feature.

trans-unit.source: If you find asking users this permission to be disruptive, you can remove it if you used it only for Mobile Engagement but at the cost of disabling big picture feature.
trans-unit.target: If you find asking users this permission to be disruptive, you can remove it if you used it only for Mobile Engagement but at the cost of disabling big picture feature.

trans-unit.source: For the location features, you should request permissions to user using a standard system dialog.
trans-unit.target: For the location features, you should request permissions to user using a standard system dialog.

trans-unit.source: If the user approves, you need to tell EngagementAgent to take that change into account in real time (otherwise the change will be processed the next time the user launches the application).
trans-unit.target: If the user approves, you need to tell EngagementAgent to take that change into account in real time (otherwise the change will be processed the next time the user launches the application).

trans-unit.source: Here is a code sample to use in an activity of your application to request permissions and forward the result if positive to EngagementAgent:
trans-unit.target: Here is a code sample to use in an activity of your application to request permissions and forward the result if positive to EngagementAgent:

trans-unit.source: Advanced reporting
trans-unit.target: Advanced reporting

trans-unit.source: Optionally, if you want to report application specific events, errors and jobs, you need to use the Engagement API through the methods of the EngagementAgent class.
trans-unit.target: Optionally, if you want to report application specific events, errors and jobs, you need to use the Engagement API through the methods of the EngagementAgent class.

trans-unit.source: An object of this class can be retreived by calling the EngagementAgent.getInstance() static method.
trans-unit.target: An object of this class can be retreived by calling the EngagementAgent.getInstance() static method.

trans-unit.source: The Engagement API allows to use all of Engagement's advanced capabilities and is detailed in the How to Use the
trans-unit.target: The Engagement API allows to use all of Engagement's advanced capabilities and is detailed in the How to Use the

trans-unit.source: Engagement API on Android (as well as in the technical documentation of the EngagementAgent class).
trans-unit.target: Engagement API on Android (as well as in the technical documentation of the EngagementAgent class).

trans-unit.source: Advanced configuration (in AndroidManifest.xml)
trans-unit.target: Advanced configuration (in AndroidManifest.xml)

trans-unit.source: If you want to be sure that statistics are sent in real time when using Wifi or when the screen is off, add the following optional permission:
trans-unit.target: If you want to be sure that statistics are sent in real time when using Wifi or when the screen is off, add the following optional permission:

trans-unit.source: If you want to disable crash reports, add this (between the and tags):
trans-unit.target: If you want to disable crash reports, add this (between the and tags):

trans-unit.source: By default, the Engagement service reports logs in real time.
trans-unit.target: By default, the Engagement service reports logs in real time.

trans-unit.source: If your application reports logs very frequently, it is better to buffer the logs and to report them all at once on a regular time base (this is called the "burst mode").
trans-unit.target: If your application reports logs very frequently, it is better to buffer the logs and to report them all at once on a regular time base (this is called the "burst mode").

trans-unit.source: To do so, add this (between the and tags):
trans-unit.target: To do so, add this (between the and tags):

trans-unit.source: The burst mode slightly increase the battery life but has an impact on the Engagement Monitor: all sessions and jobs duration will be rounded to the burst threshold (thus, sessions and jobs shorter than the burst threshold may not be visible).
trans-unit.target: The burst mode slightly increase the battery life but has an impact on the Engagement Monitor: all sessions and jobs duration will be rounded to the burst threshold (thus, sessions and jobs shorter than the burst threshold may not be visible).

trans-unit.source: It is recommended to use a burst threshold no longer than 30000 (30s).
trans-unit.target: It is recommended to use a burst threshold no longer than 30000 (30s).

trans-unit.source: By default, the Engagement service establishes the connection with our servers as soon as the network is available.
trans-unit.target: By default, the Engagement service establishes the connection with our servers as soon as the network is available.

trans-unit.source: If you want to postpone the connection, add this (between the and tags):
trans-unit.target: If you want to postpone the connection, add this (between the and tags):

trans-unit.source: By default, a session is ended 10s after the end of its last activity (which usually occurs by pressing the Home or Back key, by setting the phone idle or by jumping into another application).
trans-unit.target: By default, a session is ended 10s after the end of its last activity (which usually occurs by pressing the Home or Back key, by setting the phone idle or by jumping into another application).

trans-unit.source: This is to avoid a session split each time the user exit and return to the application very quickly (which can happen when he pick up a image, check a notification, etc.).
trans-unit.target: This is to avoid a session split each time the user exit and return to the application very quickly (which can happen when he pick up a image, check a notification, etc.).

trans-unit.source: You may want to modify this parameter.
trans-unit.target: You may want to modify this parameter.

trans-unit.source: To do so, add this (between the and tags):
trans-unit.target: To do so, add this (between the and tags):

trans-unit.source: Disable log reporting
trans-unit.target: Disable log reporting

trans-unit.source: Using a method call
trans-unit.target: Using a method call

trans-unit.source: If you want Engagement to stop sending logs, you can call:
trans-unit.target: If you want Engagement to stop sending logs, you can call:

trans-unit.source: This call is persistent: it uses a shared preferences file.
trans-unit.target: This call is persistent: it uses a shared preferences file.

trans-unit.source: If Engagement is active when you call this function, it may take 1 minute for the service to stop.
trans-unit.target: If Engagement is active when you call this function, it may take 1 minute for the service to stop.

trans-unit.source: However it won't launch the service at all the next time you launch the application.
trans-unit.target: However it won't launch the service at all the next time you launch the application.

trans-unit.source: You can enable log reporting again by calling the same function with true.
trans-unit.target: You can enable log reporting again by calling the same function with true.

trans-unit.source: Integration in your own PreferenceActivity
trans-unit.target: Integration in your own PreferenceActivity

trans-unit.source: Instead of calling this function, you can also integrate this setting directly in your existing PreferenceActivity.
trans-unit.target: Instead of calling this function, you can also integrate this setting directly in your existing PreferenceActivity.

trans-unit.source: You can configure Engagement to use your preferences file (with the desired mode) in the AndroidManifest.xml file with application meta-data:
trans-unit.target: You can configure Engagement to use your preferences file (with the desired mode) in the AndroidManifest.xml file with application meta-data:

trans-unit.source: The engagement:agent:settings:name key is used to define the name of the shared preferences file.
trans-unit.target: The engagement:agent:settings:name key is used to define the name of the shared preferences file.

trans-unit.source: The engagement:agent:settings:mode key is used to define the mode of the shared preferences file, you should use the same mode as in your PreferenceActivity.
trans-unit.target: The engagement:agent:settings:mode key is used to define the mode of the shared preferences file, you should use the same mode as in your PreferenceActivity.

trans-unit.source: The mode must be passed as a number: if you are using a combination of constant flags in your code, check the total value.
trans-unit.target: The mode must be passed as a number: if you are using a combination of constant flags in your code, check the total value.

trans-unit.source: Engagement always use the engagement:key boolean key within the preferences file for managing this setting.
trans-unit.target: Engagement always use the engagement:key boolean key within the preferences file for managing this setting.

trans-unit.source: The following example of AndroidManifest.xml shows the default values:
trans-unit.target: The following example of AndroidManifest.xml shows the default values:

trans-unit.source: Then you can add a CheckBoxPreference in your preference layout like the following one:
trans-unit.target: Then you can add a CheckBoxPreference in your preference layout like the following one:
